    <div id="commentslistp2978888" style="display:none; margin:0px 10px;">

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentleft" style="width:230px;">
      <div id="leftboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox16848675">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="16848675">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title16848675">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           How do I get the Full-text of my article?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content10472987">
          <p>
           To get the Full-Text of an article:
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you are in a library database with "Check for full text" buttons, click on "Check for full text". It will take you the full text of your article or tell you that the full-text cannot be found. If the full text is not available from Trexler Library,
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           the book or article
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you have citation information for the article (journal title, year, title, etc.), type the information about your article in the
           <a title="Citation Help Page" href="https://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/atoztitles/search?#article">
            Article Locator citation page
           </a>
           on the library website. If the library subscribes to the full text, you will be directed to tthe article. If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           - If Trexler Library does not have access to the full text of the article, search
           <a href="http://www.google.com/scholar">
            Google Scholar
           </a>
           by article title to see if the author has made a copy freely available online. Look to the far right of the article's title to see if there is a link to a freely available copy.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt10472987" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox16848677">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="16848677">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title16848677">
          <div class="bi_search">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox10472940">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="10472940">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title10472940">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Primary Sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content10472940">
          <div id="boxatt10472940" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link12729970">
              <a id="link_12729970" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://eebo.chadwyck.com/home" target="_blank" onclick="hit(12729970,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Philosophy', 'page_name' : 'Primary Sources'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12729970}); ">
               Early English Books Online
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Digital facsimile page images of virtually every work printed in England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales and British North America and works in English printed elsewhere from 1473-1700.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link12729971">
              <a id="link_12729971" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://infotrac.galegroup.com/itweb/mul_coll?db=ECCO" target="_blank" onclick="hit(12729971,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Philosophy', 'page_name' : 'Primary Sources'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12729971}); ">
               Eighteenth Century Collections Online (ECCO)
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Over 180,000 titles (200,000 volumes) comprising books, pamphlets, essays, broadsides and more based on the English Short Title Catalogue Works published in the UK during the 18th century plus thousands from elsewhere. Content covers critical information in the fields of history, literature, religion, law, fine arts, science and more. Primarily in English but also includes other languages.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link12729972">
              <a id="link_12729972" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://find.galegroup.com/ttda/start.do?userGroupName=mul_coll" target="_blank" onclick="hit(12729972,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Philosophy', 'page_name' : 'Primary Sources'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12729972}); ">
               The Times Digital Archive 1785-2006
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Since its first publication in 1785, The Times (London) has become one of the most preeminent, global daily (except Sundays) newspapers of the 18th- through early 21st-centuries centuries, covering international events, people, places, politics, business news, opinion and debate, entertainment and advertising. The Times Digital Archive makes this highly regarded resource available in an easy-to-navigate, fully-searchable online resource containing every page of every issue within the range of years displayed in the product banner.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
